page.title: 15Willfield High School
page.content: Willfield High School was built in 1956 and was opened as a secondary boys' school on Wednesday the 26th June 1957. It was opened by the General Secretary of The National Union of Teachers. Willfield was the only comprehensive school in Bentilee. When the school opened there was one headmaster and ten teachers,teaching 133 boys in the part of the school which is now called Upper school.There are two buildings callled Upper and Lower school. The schools' sports facilities include a football pitch,gymnasium and a large swimming pool. In the schools assembly hall there are two "HONOURS BOARD'S" where pupils that get a degree in university get their names printed.There is also a youth club,with boxing,art,motor-cycles ,metalwork and drama.
